name: mined
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
past simple and past participle of
mine
mine verb
(DIG)
[ I or T ] to dig coal or another substance out of the ground: They're mining for salt. They mine a lot of copper around these parts.

mine verb
(BOMB)
[ T often passive ] to place or hide mines in an area of land or sea: The desert was heavily mined.

mine verb
(GET CURRENCY)
[ T ] to use special software to try to obtain new cryptocurrency (= digital currency produced by a public network rather than by a government): Since 2009, the number of bitcoins mined has skyrocketed. Idiom
mine a rich seam of something
